1:
A good name is to be chosen over great riches\q and favor is better than silver and gold.
\q
2:
Rich and poor people have this in common—\q Yahweh is the maker of all of them.


\q
3:
A prudent man sees trouble and hides himself,\q but the naive go on and suffer because of it.
\q
4:
The reward for humility and fear of Yahweh\q is riches, honor, and life.


\q
5:
Thorns and snares lie in the path of the perverse;\q whoever guards his life will keep far from them.
\q
6:
Teach a child the way he should go\q and when he is old he will not turn away from that instruction.


\q
7:
Rich people rule over poor people\q and one who borrows is a slave to the one who lends.
\q
8:
He who sows injustice will reap trouble\q and the rod of his fury will fade away.


\q
9:
The one who has a generous eye will be blessed,\q for he shares his bread with the poor.
\q
10:
Drive away the mocker, and out goes strife;\q disputes and insults will cease.

\q
11:
The one who loves a pure heart\q and whose speech is gracious,
\q he will have the king for his friend.
\q
12:
The eyes of Yahweh keep watch over knowledge,\q but he overthrows the words of the treacherous.


\q
13:
The lazy person says, "There is a lion in the street!\q I will be killed in the open places."
\q
14:
The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit;\q Yahweh's anger is stirred up against anyone who falls into it.

\q
15:
Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child,\q but the rod of discipline drives it far away.
\q
16:
The one who oppresses poor people to increase his wealth,\q or gives to rich people, will come to poverty.


\q
17:
Incline your ear and listen to the words of the wise\q and apply your heart to my knowledge,
\q
18:
for it will be pleasant for you if you keep them within you,\q if all of them are ready on your lips.
\q
19:
So your trust may be in Yahweh,\q I teach them to you today—even to you.


\q
20:
Have I not written for you thirty sayings\q of instruction and knowledge,
\q
21:
to teach you truth in these trustworthy words,\q so you may give trustworthy answers to those who sent you?


\q
22:
Do not rob the poor because he is poor,\q or crush the needy at the gate,
\q
23:
for Yahweh will plead their case,\q and he will rob of life those who robbed them.

\q
24:
Do not make a friend of someone who is ruled by anger\q and you must not go with one who rages,
\q
25:
or you will learn his ways\q and you will take bait for your soul.


\q
26:
Do not be one who strikes hands in making a pledge,\q or who puts up security for debts.
\q
27:
If you lack the means to pay,\q what could stop someone from taking away your bed from under you?


\q
28:
Do not remove the ancient boundary stone\q that your fathers have set.
\q
29: Do you see a man skilled at his work? He will stand before kings;\q he will not stand before common people.
